{{also|problem|problém}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|la|problēma}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/pʁoˈbleːm/}} * {{audio|de|De-Problem.ogg|Audio}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Problem.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n||Probleme|Problemchen}} # [[problem]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|s|e}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|Image-Problem}} * {{l|de|Problematik}} * {{l|de|problematisch}} * {{l|de|problematisieren}} * {{l|de|Problembewusstsein}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|Problemfall}} * {{l|de|Problemkreis}} * {{l|de|problemlos}} * {{l|de|Problemstellung}} * {{l|de|unproblematisch}} {{der-bottom}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/proˈpleːm/}} ===Noun=== {{head|hrx|noun|g=n|plural|Problem}} # [[problem]] #: {{ux|hrx|Sie hod fiele Problem.|}} ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{der|lb|fr|problème}} and {{der|lb|de|Problem}}. Pronunciation and gender are based on the French word, whereas the spelling is that of German. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/ˈpʁoblæm/}} ===Noun=== {{lb-noun|m|Problemer}} # [[problem]] #: {{ux|lb|De Jugendchômage ass e '''Problem''', dee séier muss geléist ginn.|Youth unemployment is a '''problem''' that needs to be solved quickly.}}
